body: Hello @CalvinLloyd117, could you also share the content of the pose_cfg.yaml located in dlc-models/.../test?

Thanks! If you look at the CollectedData.csv file in the training-datasets folder, can you confirm the 10 baboons with 25 body parts each are found in the columns? Looking at the error you report, there is a mismatch between what's expected from your config file (indeed 10x25=250) and what is found in the annotations (3x25 maybe?) 🤔

Indeed, there are only three baboons in there....

So this is the problem then?
It is! Did you initially label data with 3 animals only and later on added extra individuals to the config?

Well, I suppose I just added 10 animals to the project initially, since I figured that was the most I would ever see in a video. Though, it turns out in my set of videos (26 or so in total) I only ever had 3 at most in a single video. Most videos I have are single animal, but I knew that there was potentially more than one, so I went with multi-animal.

I have also figured out that the best (only?) way to set differing number of animals in different videos was to comment out unused baboons in the config.yaml file, so that the 'number of animals' field in the Refine Tracklets tab was correct. I could set it to 1 this way. This also prevented the baboons from appearing as ind1, ind2, etc. Was I wrong to do this?

@CalvinLloyd117 actually not the best/only way is not to comment out the baboons; you pass the number of animals you want per video :) see the GUI, or also here:

https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/examples/COLAB_maDLC_TrainNetwork_VideoAnalysis.ipynb

```

#Check and edit:
numAnimals = 2 #how many animals do you expect to find?
tracktype= 'ellipse' #box, skeleton, ellipse -- ellipse is recommended.

#Optional: imagine you tracked a point that is not useful for assembly, 
#like a tail tip that is far from the body, consider dropping it for this step (it's still used later)!
#To drop it, uncomment the next line TWO lines and add your parts(s):
#bodypart= 'Tail_end'
#deeplabcut.convert_detections2tracklets(path_config_file, videofile_path, videotype=VideoType, shuffle=shuffle, track_method=tracktype, overwrite=True, ignore_bodyparts=[bodypart])

#OR don't drop, just click RUN:
deeplabcut.convert_detections2tracklets(path_config_file, videofile_path, videotype=VideoType, 
                                        shuffle=shuffle, track_method=tracktype, overwrite=True)

deeplabcut.stitch_tracklets(path_config_file, videofile_path, track_method=tracktype, n_tracks=numAnimals)
```

rename.to: `raise ValueError(f"Shape of passed values is {passed}, indices imply {implied}") ValueError: Shape of passed values is ...` during maDLC evaluation?

body:
Hello. Thanks for all of your responses. I would just like to clarify how I would fix this issue... Is it as simple as setting the number of animals in the config.yaml file to be the same as the max number of animals you have in any training video? In my case, since the number of animals in CollectedData.csv is three, I would have only three baboons in my config.yaml? 

Do I need to do this prior to training, or prior to evaluation?
Did you have 10 **before** you labeled in the config file, so that each labeled-data folder has 10 columns with 25 bts each or rather 3?

No, each video is different. The number of baboons ranges from 1 to 3 depending on the video, and I was modifying config.yaml before labeling each video, so that the number of animals appearing in the GUI was correct.

HI @CalvinLloyd117 that could cause major issues; see the docs where we say please be sure you know the max # in any one video for the whole set of data, then label. https://deeplabcut.github.io/DeepLabCut/docs/maDLC_UserGuide.html#configure-the-project

I.e., you would have needed to set this to 3 before labeling.... i.e, I am not sure this is fixable now if you edited the config.yaml between labeling folders...


_Individuals: are names of “individuals” in the annotation dataset. These should/can be generic (e.g. mouse1, mouse2, etc.). These individuals are comprised of the same bodyparts defined by multianimalbodyparts. For annotation in the GUI and training, it is important that all individuals in each frame are labeled. Thus, keep in mind that you need to set individuals to the maximum number in your labeled-data set, .i.e., if there is (even just one frame) with 17 animals then the list should be - indv1 to - indv17. Note, once trained if you have a video with more or less animals, that is fine - you can have more or less animals during video analysis!_

Alright... So I leave the number of animals as 10 in each video, regardless of how many are appearing?

I have attempted to modify the config as @jeylau suggests above, so that the number of columns match. The Evaluation process now progresses further, resulting in:
```
Results for 60000 training iterations: 95, shuffle 1:
Train error: 2.41 pixels. Test error: 12.63 pixels.
With pcutoff of 0.05:
Train error: 2.41 pixels. Test error: 8.56 pixels.
##########################################
Average Euclidean distance to GT per individual (in pixels)
individuals
baboon1    2.857221
baboon2    4.347877
baboon3         NaN
Average Euclidean distance to GT per bodypart (in pixels)
bodyparts
centerbrow        2.697161
centersnout       2.734634
chin              2.810183
collarbone        3.094362
leftbrow          2.497681
leftear_lower     2.337818
leftear_upper     2.227504
lefteye           2.538198
leftjaw           2.659822
leftmouth         2.649937
leftnostril       2.133808
leftshoulder      2.686445
leftsnout         2.712087
rightbrow         2.265826
rightear_lower    2.621645
rightear_upper    2.454983
righteye          2.377794
rightjaw          2.881313
rightmouth        3.035180
rightnostril      1.992739
rightshoulder     3.372172
rightsnout        2.663929
topback           3.081827
tophead           2.901086
topmouth          2.793646
Done and results stored for snapshot:  snapshot-60000
```
However, The error is now:
```
Selecting best skeleton...
270it [00:01, 140.26it/s]
270it [00:00, 12261.52it/s]
D:\Applications\Anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\pose_estimation_tensorflow\lib\crossvalutils.py:299: RuntimeWarning: invalid value encountered in true_divide
  hist_left = hist_left / hist_left.sum()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "D:\Applications\Anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\gui\evaluate_network.py", line 270, in evaluate_network
    deeplabcut.evaluate_network(
  File "D:\Applications\Anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\pose_estimation_tensorflow\core\evaluate.py", line 562, in evaluate_network
    evaluate_multianimal_full(
  File "D:\Applications\Anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\pose_estimation_tensorflow\core\evaluate_multianimal.py", line 546, in evaluate_multianimal_full
    _ = crossvalutils.cross_validate_paf_graphs(
  File "D:\Applications\Anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\pose_estimation_tensorflow\lib\crossvalutils.py", line 550, in cross_validate_paf_graphs
    paf_inds, paf_scores = _get_n_best_paf_graphs(
  File "D:\Applications\Anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\pose_estimation_tensorflow\lib\crossvalutils.py", line 506, in _get_n_best_paf_graphs
    for edge in nx.maximum_spanning_edges(G, data=False):
  File "D:\Applications\Anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\networkx\algorithms\tree\mst.py", line 177, in kruskal_mst_edges
    edges = sorted(filter_nan_edges(), key=itemgetter(0))
  File "D:\Applications\Anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\networkx\algorithms\tree\mst.py", line 174, in filter_nan_edges
    raise ValueError(msg)
ValueError: NaN found as an edge weight. Edge (0, 1, {'weight': nan})
```

because you don't have enough data for baboon 3, such that none made it into the evaluation:
```
individuals
baboon1    2.857221
baboon2    4.347877
baboon3         NaN
```
note, given the test/train error gap, I would already suggest you label more 3-animal frames though! (yet given main issue resolved I will close)

issue.title: Network evaluation bug -- ValueError

labels.name: howtousedlc
labels.description: issue regarding the use of DeepLabCut

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

Hi, 

I had trained my multianimal network successfully, but when I evaluate it on GUI, it showed ：“ ValueError : Shape of passed value is (40, 10), indices imply (40, 15)".  I started to learn Deeplabcut a few days ago. I had trained a single-animal model without this bug. So I wonder whether it was due to the multianimal mode.  

By the way, there is another bothering question. Could I continue to work with the network, if training process was accidentally killed? Actually, I had trained a previous model but it stopped at iteration 75000 out of unknown reason. I tried to reload the project and go evaluation, but got the same "ValueError" bug. I thought that was caused by the training interruption, so I copied the files and did trained again. This time training completed, but the error was still there.   

I'm fledgling in deeplabcut and I used mostly default settings. 

Many thanks！

### Operating System

Windows 10

### DeepLabCut version

deeplabcut 2.2.1.1 GUI

### DeepLabCut mode

multi animal

### Device type

GPU NVIDIA Quadro P1000

### Steps To Reproduce

1. launch DeepLabCut GUI
2. everything samed ok till training completed 
3. run: evaluate network
4. boom!

### Relevant log output

```shell
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ValueError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
File ~\anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\gui\evaluate_network.py:270, in Evaluate_network.evaluate_network(self, event)
    268 if len(self.bodyparts) == 0:
    269     self.bodyparts = "all"
--> 270 deeplabcut.evaluate_network(
    271     self.config,
    272     Shuffles=Shuffles,
    273     #trainingsetindex=trainingsetindex,
    274     plotting=plotting,
    275     show_errors=True,
    276     comparisonbodyparts=self.bodyparts,
    277 )

File ~\anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\pose_estimation_tensorflow\core\evaluate.py:601, in evaluate_network(config, Shuffles, trainingsetindex, plotting, show_errors, comparisonbodyparts, gputouse, rescale, modelprefix)
    598     from .evaluate_multianimal import evaluate_multianimal_full
    600     # TODO: Make this code not so redundant!
--> 601     evaluate_multianimal_full(
    602         config=config,
    603         Shuffles=Shuffles,
    604         trainingsetindex=trainingsetindex,
    605         plotting=plotting,
    606         comparisonbodyparts=comparisonbodyparts,
    607         gputouse=gputouse,
    608         modelprefix=modelprefix,
    609     )
    610 else:
    611     from deeplabcut.utils.auxfun_videos import imread, imresize

File ~\anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\pose_estimation_tensorflow\core\evaluate_multianimal.py:448, in evaluate_multianimal_full(config, Shuffles, trainingsetindex, plotting, show_errors, comparisonbodyparts, gputouse, modelprefix)
    445 sess.close()  # closes the current tf session
    447 # Compute all distance statistics
--> 448 df_dist = pd.DataFrame(dist, columns=df.index)
    449 df_conf = pd.DataFrame(conf, columns=df.index)
    450 df_joint = pd.concat(
    451     [df_dist, df_conf],
    452     keys=["rmse", "conf"],
    453     names=["metrics"],
    454     axis=1,
    455 )

File ~\anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\frame.py:694, in DataFrame.__init__(self, data, index, columns, dtype, copy)
    684         mgr = dict_to_mgr(
    685             # error: Item "ndarray" of "Union[ndarray, Series, Index]" has no
    686             # attribute "name"
   (...)
    691             typ=manager,
    692         )
    693     else:
--> 694         mgr = ndarray_to_mgr(
    695             data,

File ~\anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\pandas\core\internals\construction.py:351, in ndarray_to_mgr(values, index, columns, dtype, copy, typ)
    346 # _prep_ndarray ensures that values.ndim == 2 at this point
    347 index, columns = _get_axes(
    348     values.shape[0], values.shape[1], index=index, columns=columns
    349 )
--> 351 _check_values_indices_shape_match(values, index, columns)
```

### Anything else?

_No response_
